u_\rI(x) &= A e^{ikx} + Be^{-ikx}, & u_\rII(x) &= C e^{ik'x} + De^{-ik'x},

children.value: In this question we will find the energy eigenstates for the finite potential well that correspond to a right-moving particle. The potential energy of the particle is

children.html: V(x)={0if 0≤x≤a,V0if x<0 or x>a.V(x) = \begin{cases} 0 & \text{if } 0 \leq x \leq a, \\ V_0 & \text{if } x < 0 \text{ or } x > a. \end{cases}V(x)={0V0​​if 0≤x≤a,if x<0 or x>a.​

children.value: We are interested in solving the time-independent Schrödinger equation when

children.html: E>V0E > V_0E>V0​

children.value: . We will call the region to the left of the well, such that

children.html: x<0x < 0x<0

children.value: , Region I, the region inside the well, such that

children.html: 0≤x≤a0 \leq x \leq a0≤x≤a

children.value: , Region II, and the region to the right of the well, such that

children.html: x≥ax \geq ax≥a

children.value: Solve the time-independent Schrödinger equation separately in the three regions, to show that the solution in each region is, respectively

u_\rI(x) &= A e^{ik'x} + Be^{-ik'x}, \\
            u_\rII(x) &= C e^{ikx} + De^{-ikx},\\ 
            u_\rIII(x) &= F e^{ik'x} + Ge^{-ik'x},

children.value: Finally, show that the reflection coefficient is given by

children.html: R=∣B∣2∣A∣2=(k2−k′2)2sin⁡2ka4k2k′2+(k2−k′2)2sin⁡2ka.R = \frac{|B|^2}{|A|^2} = \frac{(k^2-k'^2)^2 \sin^2 ka}{4k^2 k'^2 + (k^2-k'^2)^2 \sin^2 ka}.R=∣A∣2∣B∣2​=4k2k′2+(k2−k′2)2sin2ka(k2−k′2)2sin2ka​.
